Text: @exp Kurobei.Puzlle.Idle: Does it really...look good on me?
Well, that's it. You'd better call me Teacher from now on.
@exp Gabiru.Puzzle.Idle: I'm not sure I should be wearing this...
@exp Gobta.Grin.Idle: Great Rimuru, we'll stick by your side to the end!
Oh, thank you. I'm counting on you, Gobta!
@exp Hakuro.Normal.Idle: I can't contribute to the development of this town the way Rigurd's crew are, but I can at least keep watch.
Don't be so humble. With you on the lookout, everyone can relax and focus on their work.
@exp GazelDwargo.Smile.Exclusive_1:Ah, Rimuru. Just the man I was looking for. I've got a little present for ya. Here.
Well thank you. Don't mind if I do!
@exp GeldDefault.Normal.Proposal:As a representative of the Orcs, I would like to once again offer our deepest gratitude for accepting us as your servants.
Please use us freely as you see fit.
I'm depending on you guys! But let me know if you ever need anything, all right?
@exp GeldDefault.Sad.Sigh:Oh, never. We have no such right. Our crimes cannot be expunged so easily...
It's all right. Like I told you before, I've accepted responsibility for all of that.
@exp GeldDefault.Normal.Joy:...Thank you very much. We will work very hard to repay you for your kindness.
All right, if you want to repay me, you can start by not being so formal.
@exp GeldDefault.Sad.Sad:Yes, sir. We will endeavor not to disappoint you.
@exp GazelDwargo.Smile.Exclusive_1: It's good to see both Kaijin and Vesta doing so well. I admit it's a bit annoying to see, too...
@exp Rigurd.Smile.Exclusive_1:Great Rimuru, would you be so kind as to accept this small gift? It symbolizes our appreciation for what you do for us every single day.
Oh, thanks. Don't mind if I do!
@exp RimuruSlimeDefault.Normal.Surprise:Wow, things really are looking nice around here now!
@exp RigurdDefault.Smile.Nod:It's thanks to your leadership, Great Rimuru.
@exp RigurdDefault.None.Think:When you compare this to the settlement we used to live in before we met you, Great Rimuru, this feels like a dream come true...
@exp RimuruSlimeDefault.Normal.Joy:Don't be satisfied with just this, okay? We'll use this central office as a base for building an even more amazing town!
Sorry to keep you waiting. Are these the food items you wanted?
@exp GazelDwargo.Cool.Idle:Hmm, indeed. I see the quality level of ingredients you can procure here isn't quite the same as what's available in our kingdom, though.
@exp GazelDwargo.Smile.Exclusive_1:Thank you for the meal, Rimuru. In return...ah yes, allow me, Master Swordsman Gazel himself, to offer you a round of training!
What?! You're giving me a round of training in return?!
@exp Hakuro.Smile.Idle: There aren't many towns this big in the human world, and yet it still shows no signs of halting its development.
They appear to be fighting a high-ranking Orc. What action shall I take?
Well, I mean... We have to help them, don't we? Can you win?
He didn't even hesitate! A real dreamboat, this one. Do it, then. We'll be there soon.
Assume battle formation, everyone! Let's go!
Oh, boy. That Souei really is skilled.
He should've left some for us.
Ah. Here, drink this. Don't worry. It's a healing potion.
Oh... My wound! I thought it was fatal. Wh-Who are you?
I must ask a favor of you! Please save my father, the Lizardman chieftain, and my brother Gabiru!
My brother Gabiru led a rebellion and imprisoned the chieftain.
I believe he intends to repel the Orc army on his own, but he has underestimated the Orc Lord. If we take no action, the Lizardmen will surely be exterminated.
My father helped me escape during a lapse in the guard's attention. I am aware that this is a selfish request!
But I beg mercy from you who serve such a powerful majin! Please, Please!
Well said, indeed! That you recognize our leader Rimuru's greatness means you have potential!
I'm certain the Lizardmen can be saved.
(The way she just accepts work for me on her own... She's definitely a secretary. What choice do we have? We'll be fighting the Orc Lord, either way.)
So, um... You're Gabiru's sister and the chieftain's daughter, you say?
Then I'll acknowledge you as a representative of the chieftain. Do you object to forging an alliance right here and now?
Then it's settled. The alliance is complete.
And it's only natural that we help our alliance partner, right?
Souei, can you use Shadow Movement to get to the chieftain from here?
I ask that you rescue the Lizardman chieftain.
@exp RimuruDefault.Smile.Proposal:Lucky you, Benimaru. There are still some left.
@exp BenimaruDefault.Smile.Exclusive_1:But it's not enough to even pass the time.
Hmm... Big, brawny me and little me are equally powerful, so why do I feel cheated?
It's just two of me working hard.
@exp Milim.Grin.Idle:Wahahahahahaaa! That was so fun! Ask me again any time!
Sure, but what's going on with you? You had fun even though it wasn't much of a challenge?
@exp Milim.Smile.Exclusive_1:Teeheehee. I figured it out! I can have fun no matter what the monster is. The main thing is to go together with you, my bestie!
Oh. So in other words, whenever you want to play, you'll pretty much be satisfied as long as I go with you? Is that it?
That's it! All right, I'm not done playing yet! Let's play some more!
*sigh* Oh, all right. As long as it's not every day. I guess there's nothing wrong with having a fan.
@exp Treyni.Grin.Exclusive_1: Don't worry about me, I'm always enjoying myself.
Heh, I kinda figured as much.
This is an important day in your life, isn't it Great Rimuru? I've prepared a small gift in commemoration of this day.
Thank you, Souei! But how did you know?
@exp Soei.Bitter.Exclusive_1:Spies have their methods... Well. I'd like to say that, but the truth of the matter is, rumors spread quickly in a town like this.
Any interest in getting a little trim, Ranga?
@exp Benimaru.Bitter.Exclusive_1: I wonder how much more I'll have to train before I'm as strong as you, Great Rimuru.
Oh don't worry, you're already pretty amazing as it is...
@exp Benimaru.Smile.Exclusive_1: Great Rimuru, I've found something handy. I think you'd find it more useful than I would, so please, take it.
Yeah? You sure? You're a good man, Benimaru.
@exp Gobta.Sad.Idle:Hey, no fair! You fought back!
What, you really thought I'd just let you punch me?!
@exp Gobta.Angry.Exclusive_1:Argh! You just don't want anyone to know if you're really a slime or not, Great Rimuru!
I've been saying I'm a slime all along...
@exp Geld.Normal.Idle:Great Rimuru... There's something I'd like to ask your help with today...
Oh-ho, now you're coming right to me with your problems! What happened? I'm happy to listen, spit it out!

Thank you, sir. The construction work is on track to reach another milestone, and although it's coming along more smoothly thanks to your assistance, it looks like we're about to run low on materials again, and...
Say no more. Leave it to me! I'm just glad you came out and asked me this time!
@exp Geld.Smile.Exclusive_1:I promised I would, Great Rimuru. Thank you once again!
@exp Benimaru.Puzzle.Exclusive_1: Sometimes I wonder if you intentionally leave the hassle of coordinating all the nitty-gritty details to me, Great Rimuru...
Hahahahaa! What are you talking about? You're excellent at your job, Benimaru, so of course I depend on you!
@exp Benimaru.Smile.Exclusive_1: Great Rimuru, I've found something handy. I think you'd find it more useful than I would, so please, take it.
Yeah? You sure? You're a good man, Benimaru.
What is that...? It's not a black wolf or a gray wolf, is it? And what's a Hobgoblin doing with such nice equipment, anyway?
Never mind that, though... How is it so incredibly strong?
Anyway, this spider sure looks delicious. Time for a feast!
I'm the representative of this town...or nation...called the Jura Tempest Federation. My name's Rimuru Tempest.
By the way, Rimuru, there are some folks here we didn't see last time.
Oh, yeah. This is Benimaru, Shion, Souei, and Shuna...
And I'm Milim. Nice to meet you!
So, the Kingdoms of Blumund and Falmuth have both come to investigate this place?
Wait a minute. Why is a slime acting like such a bigshot?! It makes no sense! What's the deal here? Why are all of you okay with this?
Sorry about what Shion did. She has trouble restraining herself sometimes. Cut her some slack.
That's mean! I'm actually known for my patience!
Bwahaha! You've got a long way to go if you're that impatient, Shion! You're so short-tempered because you don't have an open mind like I do.
I want to be on good terms with Humans. I hope we can trade and network with you all someday, too.
Yeah. We've actually entered into diplomatic relations with the Dwarven Kingdom already.
I think passing through this land would be more convenient for your merchants. What do you think?
Now, wait a minute! You're saying that Dwargon acknowledges this nation of monsters as legitimate? That doesn't sound right...
Sorry, but fire has no effect on me. I'll show you some serious flames.
That flame... It's not produced by using the surrounding magicules! The only thing forming that flame is his pure strength!
And the size of the flame mirrors the size of his power...
It's obvious who has the mightiest flames. What now? Still want to fight?
Young master, please take the princess and flee. I will end this.
You know I can't do that, old man.
It saddens me to say it, but it seems we are no match for you. Still, I have my pride as the next leader of the powerful Ogre clan!
And what leader would fail to avenge his slain brethren?! Even if I can't win, I will still fight back!
Young master, if you fight, I will fight by your side!
Wait, Brother! This individual may not be our enemy!
Why? He's a masked majin, just like the one who attacked our village! You said so yourself!
Yes, but...please, try to think this through calmly. Why would such a powerful majin force Orcs to attack our village? It makes no sense.
He surely has the power to kill us all on his own, if he so desired... I don't think he has any connection to those who attacked us.
Feeling a little more willing to listen now?
And this mask is a keepsake from someone I knew. Feel free to see for yourself whether it's the same one your attacker used.
But the majin from back then wasn't concealing their aura.
Forgive us. It seems our desperation caused a grave misunderstanding. Please accept my apology.
Sure, I accept. But this is no place to talk. Let's head back to the village. You guys should come with us.
Yep. I want to hear about what you've been through.
We did the same to you guys. But no one died, so let's leave it at that. Plus, we're having a feast today. The more, the merrier, right?
By the way, what's your name?
Oh, yeah. I forgot, most of you don't. Right, right...
@exp Milim.Grin.Exclusive_1: This is nice! It looks good on me, right?
Whew... So that's done. Of course, they might attack again...
Rigurd, would you mind putting a pause on that plan for now? I'd like to focus on protecting the town and keeping a lookout for more attacks.
Sorry, I know you've been making all sorts of preparations...
@exp Rigurd.Angry.Exclusive_1:Say no more. My plans can be resumed at any time. Protecting this town you built is the number one priority!
All sorts of people live here now. I wonder if the town is about to grow even bigger.
I hear that you sometimes take care of other Dryads, too. Thank you for your kindness.
@exp Hakuro.Smile.Idle:What's wrong, Great Rimuru? Have you given up?
Argh, I can't believe it! I put a lot of work into my One Hundred Hakurou Bewilderment Ideas in a Row strategy, and not a single one of them had any effect...
My failure was in selecting ideas without a chance of working...
@exp Hakuro.Smile.Exclusive_1:Ho-ho, you still underestimate your opponent, Great Rimuru. Now, time for today's training...
@exp Treyni.Smile.Exclusive_1: Since you became chancellor of the forest, the population has grown, and the town is absolutely thriving.
@exp Benimaru.Puzzle.Exclusive_1:Oh no, this is not good...
What is it, Benimaru? Problem with the troops?
@exp Benimaru.Smile.Idle:No, that's not it. I put your advice to good use there. Everyone's cooperating very nicely.
I'm troubled by a different matter now. We need some supplies, but no one is free...
Huh... What is it you needed?

Answer: Insufficient materials to enhance battle skills of individual {0} {1} in troop.
Acquisition of {2} recommended.
Good, it looks like everything's okay. Sorry to worry you, Chloe. You're fine now!
@exp Benimaru.Normal.Exclusive_1: Sometimes I envy Kaijin and his Dwarves. They can contribute to your cause even when there's no emergency situation, Great Rimuru.
We can focus on building the town up because we know you'll be there if we ever need you.
@exp Benimaru.Smile.Exclusive_1: Great Rimuru, I've found something handy. I think you'd find it more useful than I would, so please, take it.
Yeah? You sure? You're a good man, Benimaru.
@exp Soei.Cool.Idle:You created a new path. A new way for us to live. Not a day goes by that we forget that.
@exp Soei.Bitter.Exclusive_1:This symbolizes our thankfulness. Here, put it to good use.
You're embarrassing me. But thank you, Souei. I can definitely use this.
@exp Kurobei.Smile.Idle: Stopping by the workshop today, Great Rimuru?
Yeah, when I have time. See you then.
@exp Ranga.Puzzle.Idle:I expect Gobta to grow strong someday, so why does he keep shirking his training duties?
I think...that might have something to do with his training partner. I sort of understand why he wants to run away...
Hey Treyni, do you want us to let you know before we do anything in our town?
@exp Treyni.Smile.Exclusive_1: You don't have to, but I would appreciate it. I never get bored, watching how the town grows...
@exp Gobta.Grin.Exclusive_1: Think I could get away with slacking just a little bit?
@exp TryaDefault.Normal.Bow:Great Rimuru, thank you for taking care of my big sister. We'll be visiting too from time to time.
My sister and I look forward to working with you.
Please feel free to come by and relax here whenever you feel like it.
(After all, Treyni pops up in town all the time, too.)
@exp TryaDefault.Smile.Exclusive_1:Thank you. I don't mind if I do.
@exp RimuruSlimeDefault.Normal.Joy: Kaijin, is it true that you were able to dig up a magistone from somewhere close to the town?
@exp KaijinDefault.Normal.Nod: That's right. I was looking for another component, and I just lucked out and found it.
@exp KaijinDefault.Smile.Idle: Sir, what do you think of the idea of digging more seriously for them? We might find a lot of magistones, you know.
@exp RimuruSlimeDefault.Normal.Nod: Hmm... I'd say it sounds like it's worth a try.
@exp RimuruSlimeDefault.Normal.Think: But if we're gonna dig seriously for them, we'll need the right facilities, don't you think?
@exp KaijinDefault.Smile.Joy: Leave all of that to me, sir! Mining for rocks is what us Dwarves do best!
@exp Kaijin.Smile.Exclusive_1:Ooh, Rimuru! How was the sword? Give it to me straight.
It may just be a prototype, but... it's light and easy to use. It's a fantastic sword that any shop would be proud to sell.
But if we're gonna have King Gazel use it for a long period of time... I'm concerned about its durability.
@exp Kaijin.Normal.Idle:I see... Well, you've actually gone up against him. If that's what you think, then I'm sure it's the truth.
Thank you. I'll make the next version right away! Based on your observations, of course.
Kaijin and the three Dwarf brothers are going to be working here in our town from now on...
I know none of you can go home to your kingdom, but are you sure this is okay?
@exp KaijinDefault.Normal.Think:Rimuru, thank you for your concern. But there's really no need.
We are in your debt. If we had turned down your offer and insisted on staying home, it would have dishonored King Gazel.
@exp KaijinDefault.Smile.Proposal:From now on, we'll live in a place you'll prepare for us. Right?
Ah, yes. Leave that to me!
I'll need your help on lots of things! Be ready to work!
Here, this is what you wanted, right? Check and see if that's enough.
@exp Benimaru.Surprise.Idle:Um, yes. With this much, we should be fine. Did you gather all this just for us, Great Rimuru?!

You should feel free to use anyone with time on their hands, Benimaru, even if it's your superior officer. Don't hesitate to ask for help if you find yourself in trouble. That just makes things worse.

@exp Benimaru.Cool.Exclusive_1:Great Rimuru... You went and gathered this in order to teach me that lesson, didn't you? I'm sure there are similar situations that arise in the middle of a battle. Thank you for this lesson.
(Oh, no need to thank me. I'm just rattling off the things I learned as an adult. There's an old saying that applies here, but I can't quite remember it... )
What just happened? They're clearly moving faster now!
Impossible! Webbed feet on an Orc?! Th-That...
That makes them just like us!
They just ate one of our men!
Indeed! It was then that their movements changed!
Are they gaining our powers by eating us?!
Protect the Goblins and fall back! Hurry!
If it was just us, perhaps we could have escaped, but bringing the Goblins worked against us in the end!
Trample all! Trample all! Trample all! Our allies' powers will become our own! The enemy's powers will become our own!
Do not fear! Show them the strength upon which we Lizardmen pride ourselves!
What an intimidating aura... You, Orc!
You are the Orc Lord, correct? I am Gabiru, chieftain of the Lizardmen! Face me one-on-one to settle this—
I am not the Lord. I am an Orc General. The great Orc Lord is far superior to me.
You're not the Orc Lord? Even with this much power, you're far inferior?
You wish to fight one-on-one? Interesting. I accept.
Just what kind of monster is the real Orc Lord, then?!
@exp Treyni.Smile.Exclusive_1:You're a big help, Great Rimuru. Thanks to you, I've finished my last work helping out in the kitchen.
Oh, it's nothing...huh? Your last work?

@exp Treyni.Normal.Idle:Yes. I have to get back to my job as caretaker of the forest. Besides, I wasn't actually able to help out all that much in the kitchen. So I told them today would be my last day.

Also, watching them work in the kitchen, I've realized something. Even more than the desire to cook for myself, I prefer to enjoy watching delicious-looking food come together as someone else cooks it.
@exp Treyni.Shy.Exclusive_1:It's embarrassing to admit it, but it looks like I enjoy eating more than cooking!
Ah, haha, I know exactly how you feel! We'll learn how to make all sorts of new dishes, so look forward to it!
@exp Hakuro.Smile.Idle: Who could have predicted this town growing so big? I'm glad I lived to see the day.
@exp Hakuro.Smile.Exclusive_1: I feel like the youngsters are developing as well under your leadership, Great Rimuru. Hohoho, I can't wait to see what fine people they become!
@exp RimuruSlimeDefault.Normal.Think:Hey Rigurd, don't you think things are getting a bit crowded around here?
@exp RigurdDefault.Cool.Think:Definitely. The names you have gifted people with have caused many to grow larger and stronger, to boot.
@exp RimuruSlimeDefault.Normal.Proposal:You were still the first, Rigurd! Setting that aside for the moment though, let's move outta here and build a town!
@exp RimuruSlimeDefault.Normal.Exclusive_1:Yup, and we'll start with the central office! Let's make a town where monsters can live in peace!
Hmph. Everything's so delicious. You'll have to teach my kingdom your cooking techniques...
@exp Hakuro.Smile.Exclusive_1: This is a good town. It's vibrant, the children are laughing... It's the very embodiment of peace.
Very well said. Everyone's working so diligently, I really don't have to do all that much.
@exp Gobta.Grin.Exclusive_1: Great Rimuru, are you a Shuna fan? Or more of a Shion fan?
Heyyy! Shut up with that crazy talk! You don't wanna get them started if one of them hears you!
Did this village have a girl that cute in it?
Oh, Rigurd! That woman who was just—
What happened in the last three days?!
It's because you gave us names!
Becoming a monster with a name raises one's rank as a monster and causes one to evolve!
I-I see... So that's why you were all so happy just to be getting names.
And that crazy amount of evolution explains why my magicules got sucked dry.
Master, allow me to express my utmost joy at your recovery!
That horn... The star on your forehead... You're Ranga, right?
Great Rimuru! Great Rimuru has awakened!
You've all gotten so big. Rigurd and Rigur and... Gobta? You didn't change much.
But it's not so much like they evolved. They're like totally different monsters.
The male Goblins have evolved into Hobgoblins, and the females into Goblinas.
I get why the Goblins evolved, but why'd all of the Direwolves evolve, too? I'm pretty sure I only named Ranga.
All of us are as one. Our brethren are all connected.
Therefore, my name has become our clan's name.
So that's why all you Direwolves evolved.
We are no longer the Direwolves. We are the Tempest Wolves!
Tempest Wolves... Well, you obviously look different now, but have your abilities improved?
But of course, Great Rimuru! Allow me to show you my newly acquired lightning attack. It's at the ready should anyone or anything try to do you harm!
Rigurd, Rigur, you guys come too. I want to take you on now that you've evolved.
I want to see how powerful you've become and what you're good at for future reference.
Understood! Considering how powerful you are, Great Rimuru, there's no need for us to hold back. We'll go all out!
@exp Kurobei.Smile.Exclusive_1: This is wasted on me...
Sorry to keep you waiting. Mind saying this was from you and me?
@exp Geld.Normal.Idle:Ah, it'll be an honor! To think that I'd rely on you for this as well, Great Rimuru...
I appreciate what kind of difficult position you're in, Geld. Don't hesitate to ask if you need anything else.
@exp Geld.Smile.Exclusive_1:Great Rimuru...thank you from the bottom of my heart!
@exp Treyni.Smile.Idle:Congratulations, Great Rimuru. I've been looking forward to this day, too.
@exp Treyni.Smile.Exclusive_1:I've prepared this small item in the hope that this will be a wonderful day for you, Great Rimuru.
Right from the hands of a caretaker of the forest... Thank you, Treyni. It's an honor.
Now that was a sight to see. Wish I had a mirror to show them!
Don't think they can take much more. Hey, guys, let's take a breather.
A puddle's as good as a mirror. Yep, still a slime no matter how many times I look.
@exp RimuruSlime.None.Think:Huh? Why are we back in the village?
Answer: It appears that you have been drawn into a virtual space that simulates the past.
@exp RimuruSlime.None.Idle:A space that simulates the past? What the heck's that? ...Hm?
Gobta? Ranga? You guys all right? You don't look so good.
@exp GobtaAnother.Angry.Exclusive_1:Gobta? Who's that? And who're you, slime?
@exp RimuruSlime.None.Surprise:Huh? Enough with the jokes already! My feelings get hurt easier than you'd expect! It's me! Me, Rimuru!
@exp RangaBeforeAnother.Angry.Idle:Hmph, a slime with a name? How absurd. Even I don't have a name.
Huh? What are you talking about? Your name is Ranga.
@exp RangaBeforeAnother.Angry.Angry:I am a nameless Guitar Wolf! I am the new Wolf Lord that evolved using that odious thread that hampered my father.
@exp RimuruSlime.None.Think:Guitar Wolf? What the heck's that?

Answer: In this virtual space simulating the past, Direwolves have conquered steel threads, thereby gaining the skills Steel Thread and Sticky Thread. And it appears that they have evolved into a new species known as Guitar Wolves.

@exp GobtaAnother.Angry.Idle:I said good riddance to that weakling I was yesterday and said hello to my newfound power, 
@exp GobtaAnother.Angry.Angry:and the future I always wanted!
@exp RimuruSlime.None.Surprise:Black Lightning... Gobta, you can do that?!
Beings who were once Goblins absorbed the power of the Direwolves, gaining lightning skills. It appears they have evolved into a new species known as Lightning Ogres.
Are you telling me Gobta went through some kind of weird evolution, too?!
@exp GobtaAnother.Angry.Idle:Gobta, Gobta. Would you stop calling me that already?
Wait. Come to think of it, I was able to give out names whenever I wanted to. Hey, your name is now...Gobta!
I was afraid of that. Looks like I can't assign names. The rules in this world must be different.
@exp GobtaAnother.Angry.Idle:I'm not some monster that simply received a name like Rigur. I evolved by absorbing the Direwolves' power on my own.
(The Great Sage said this was a virtual world simulating the past. So I'm in another world...that's in another world? How confusing!)
I'm going to take your power, slime!
We're on our way to the Dwarven Kingdom. I'm traveling at 50 miles per hour, and I've secured myself with Sticky Thread so I don't fall off.
Descending into the valley was a frightening experience. And when I saw the Goblins...
@exp GazelDwargo.Smile.Exclusive_1:Here. Take this, Rimuru. I'm interested in seeing how you use it.
Hmm... How I use it? I'm not sure that it'll meet your expectations, but I'll definitely use it to the best of my abilities.
@exp Milim.Shy.Exclusive_1:Rimuru, this is a special day, right? So I got this for you, my bestie! Now be happy!
Oh, thanks! I'm surprised, I didn't expect you to notice.
Oh, Great Rimuru. Are you taking a look around the town?
Hello, Hakurou. Yup, that's all I'm doing.
Huh? Trya? It's been a while.
@exp Trya.Smile.Idle:Teehee, yes it has. I've been watching this town from afar for a while. I see it's grown once again.
When the population grows like this, there's no option other than to develop more land. We're still doing our best not to harm the forest though, you know?
@exp Trya.Smile.Exclusive_1:Yes, I can tell you've been careful. And that's why I'm willing to tell you about another secret place of mine.
Go have a look, if you'd like. I know you'll be glad you did.
@exp GazelDwargo.Smile.Exclusive_1: Hmph, not bad. It's a fine little town you've established here. Just don't rest on your laurels, all right?
@exp Rigurd.Grin.Idle:This is a big day for you, Great Rimuru! And so it is a big day for us, too!
@exp Rigurd.Grin.Exclusive_1:I know it is presumptuous of me to offer you this, but I put my entire heart and soul into preparing it for you!
Oh, thank you! But please...relax. You're making me feel pressured, too.
@exp RimuruSlimeDefault.Smile.Joy:With all the new people coming in, this central office building has been feeling a bit cramped. Your decision to rebuild it was the right one, Rigurd!
@exp RigurdDefault.Smile.Nod:I think so. It's not just the size of the building. The interior is more convenient than before, too.
@exp RigurdDefault.None.Exclusive_1:It would please me, Great Rimuru, if you were to exercise your shrewd administrative skills here!
@exp RimuruSlimeDefault.Puzzle.Sad:Uh, yeah... About that. My policy is to reign but not to rule, so...
@exp RimuruSlimeDefault.Smile.Nod:But having said that, I know I need to match your hard work, right?!
@exp Ranga.Normal.Exclusive_1:My Master, would you mind accompanying me on another hunt? I've obtained new information.
Ah yes, that thing you were looking for. Where shall we go today?
@exp Ranga.None.Idle:Let's go to the western forest. My information indicates that a powerful magical beast was spotted in that area...
Gotcha. No time like the present.
@exp Ranga.Shy.Exclusive_1:Thank you for saying that, Master! Please, ride upon my back.

@exp Vesta.Normal.Idle:Great Rimuru, all of my experiments have finally produced results. Now all I have to do is put the finished product in a place with a high density of magicules, and make it absorb all the magicules it can.
A place with a high density of magicules... You mean like Veldora's cave?
@exp Vesta.Normal.Exclusive_1:Very perceptive of you, Great Rimuru. That should be the most efficient location for absorbing magicules. Once that's done, you'll see what I've created!
Oh, I can't wait! I'll go with you, then.

I mean, he seemed a bit stupefied there for a second, but that's all. That response was all I could get with every bit of my strength. I'm so embarrassed...
@exp Hakuro.Smile.Exclusive_1:I'm not sure I understand what just happened, but...I suppose I won another one. Very well, let's start the customary training session.
@exp Benimaru.Smile.Idle:Great Rimuru, perfect timing! Would you mind if I asked for your help once more in gathering materials?
No problem! Like I said before, don't hesitate to ask for help.
@exp Benimaru.Smile.Exclusive_1:That's it. Thanks to your advice, Great Rimuru, I feel like I'll be able to lead the troops well.
That's good to hear. I'm glad my advice was helpful. All right, leave the material-gathering to me.
@exp Hakuro.Smile.Exclusive_1: It doesn't look a thing like it used to back at the beginning. Let's keep giving it our all.
@exp Hakuro.Smile.Idle: I drink with Rigurd a lot. We're both old farts, so we see eye-to- eye.
You rebuilt the central office building as the town developed... @exp RimuruDefault.None.Think: I know it was necessary, but did it also have to look this fancy?
@exp RigurdDefault.Smile.Proposal:Hahaha, what are you talking about, Great Rimuru? You're the one governing this town. Anything less would be beneath you.
@exp RimuruDefault.None.Sigh:Hearing you say that really does ramp up the pressure on me... Anyway, let's make this an even better town for everyone!
@exp Shuna.Grin.Idle: Great Rimuru, I have a new outfit I'd love to see you try on.
Sure, but...it's not a girl's outfit, is it?
Gabiru, you lent me your spear for a bit, remember? Thanks to that, I learned a few things about it.
The reason is simple. You need to maintain it better!
@exp Gabiru.Surprise.Idle:What?! I need to maintain it better?! Oh... Well, now that you mention it, I haven't done anything like that lately.
It doesn't matter how fine a weapon is. If you don't maintain it properly, you won't be able to use it to its full capabilities. I've spoken to Kaijin about this, so go have him work on your spear!
I'll go get the materials you'll need for the grinding stone. Go get a large amount of clean water for the polishing!
@exp RimuruSlimeDefault.Normal.Proposal: We invited you and your Dwarves to come here, so you'll need houses too, Kaijin!
@exp KaijinDefault.Puzzle.Sigh: I appreciate that, Rimuru. But you know, all we really need is a place to sleep.
@exp RimuruSlimeDefault.Normal.Bow: Oh no, that won't do. It's got to be a comfortable place. Somewhere you can relax. Can't have exhaustion interfering with your work, after all.
@exp KaijinDefault.Smile.Joy: Ah, thankee, thankee. We'll pay you back in full with our smithing, sir!
I think we've done enough spying for the moment.
Aww... But I'm not done yet!
Don't sulk, now... More importantly, what'd you think of your papa?
He was sooo coool! I wanna join him!
It's a little early for that. But don't worry. You'll meet him soon.
Oh yeah, almost forgot to introduce myself.
I'm Rimuru. Rimuru Tempest. I was reincarnated as a slime for some reason.
I've got friends I can depend on and a village to protect. I've come to really enjoy the life I have here.
It's been a long time since the day I got reincarnated. The day I woke up in that cave...
@exp Soei.Cool.Exclusive_1:Good, this should work perfectly. Now all we have to do is watch and see how effective it really is...
Hey Souei, you set up that security network you were thinking of making? How about testing it against me? I want to see what it's like for myself.
@exp Soei.Surprise.Idle:You'd be willing to test my security network as an invader, Great Rimuru? That would be ideal! Are you sure it's okay?
Oh, of course! All right, I'll walk towards the town from some place in the forest. If I run into any magical beasts, I'll take care of them on the way.
@exp Treyni.Smile.Exclusive_1:Princess Shuna and her friends are researching sweet flavors all the time. I wonder if they're looking for an official taster?
I'm sure I could help them with their research...
@exp Gobta.Puzzle.Idle: Gobzoooh! Where does he keep running off to...?
@exp RimuruDefault.None.Relax: The Great Forest of Jura is full of edible things...but we'll have to grow our own food too, if want to stabilize our food supply.
@exp RigurdDefault.Surprise.Surprise: Huh? What? Grow our own, you say?!
@exp RimuruDefault.None.Think: Of course we'll still depend on the forest's bounty, but don't you think our food supply would be more dependable if we could also grow some things on our own?
@exp RimuruDefault.None.Proposal:If we do it right, it'll definitely be a good thing for our town. Let's all plant a field together!

@exp Gobta.Surprise.Idle: So this is our town, huh... 
@exp Gobta.Grin.Idle: Let's make it even bigger, Great Rimuru!
If we're taking on an army of 200,000 Orcs...
I feel like we should consider an alliance with the Lizardmen, but given the guy they had representing them...
I'd really like to talk to someone who'd actually listen...
Great Rimuru. Would you mind if I spoke personally with the chieftain of the Lizardmen?
Okay, then. We'll join forces with the Lizardmen and attack the Orcs.
The battle will probably take place in the marshlands inhabited by the Lizardmen. Their cooperation is essential for this to work. I'm counting on you, Souei.
I hope their chieftain isn't an idiot like Gabiru.
Wh-Where are we? That's right! I was...
...defeated by that boy with the dopey face. They clearly tricked us.
It's simple. That boy who beat me is obviously the real master of that village!
He must be, or Sir Gabiru wouldn't have lost!
What a dirty trick, lowering Sir Gabiru's guard with such lies!
Now, calm down. Such is the wisdom of the weak.
That's our Sir Gabiru! What a great man you are! Great as a mountain!
Oh, no, I'm really not so— Wait, who?! Wha'?!
He's been here this whole time.
You're just as great as I've heard! My name is Laplace.
I've come as a servant of Lord Gelmud to give you a warning.
He's the man who gave Sir Gabiru his name.
Thank you for taking the trouble! So, what is Lord Gelmud's warning?
Well, we have quite the situation on our hands!
It seems that the army of Orcs really is being led by an Orc Lord.
The Lizardman chieftain is a capable man, but he's getting up there in years, you know! Frankly speaking, don't you think this is a bit much for Daddy to handle?
I had planned to take over as chieftain after we had fought off the Orcs, but it seems that would be too late!
Laplace, forgive my leaving so abruptly, but we—
Oh, it's fine, it's fine! You're going back to the marshlands, right? You should hurry!
Do the best you can, Gabiru.
Chieftain, what shall we do? The Orc army is approaching.
What can we do but remain here? We have no means to fight an army of 200,000 Orcs.
Chieftain! We have an intruder! He demands an audience with you!
Very well. Bring him to me.
You can feel this aura, as well?
Yes. This is no simple intruder. With this one, even a hundred of the strongest Lizardmen would stand no chance.
Forgive me, but my hands are rather tied at the moment. I cannot spare any hospitality.
No need to trouble yourself. I am only a messenger, here to convey to you the words of my master.
My master desires an alliance with the Lizardmen.
An alliance? But I have no knowledge of your master.
My master is the great Rimuru Tempest. Upon receiving a personal request from the Dryads, he has sworn to defeat the approaching Orc army.
A personal request from the caretakers of the forest?
She informed us that the Orc army is led by an Orc Lord. Keep in mind what that means as you consider our proposal.
Rimuru, you say? Never heard of him!
He probably just came crying to us because he fears the Orc Lord! He should just be honest and ask for help.
Ch-Chieftain! Such complacency will lead others to belittle—
I apologize for my comrade's rudeness. Would you please forgive him? This offer does benefit both of us equally, does it not?
Forgive me. It was not my intent to threaten him, but I will not stand for such mockery of my master.
(Strong words. Had I not stopped him, he would have taken his head in a heartbeat.)
Judging by your aura, you appear to be an Ogre from the southwest.
Not anymore. My master granted me the name Souei, and I became a Kijin.
The superior race born only rarely from among the Ogres!
If that is true, it would mean that your master is of an even more superior race than the Kijin.
An offer from a powerful man to enter an alliance immediately after the appearance of the Orc Lord...I have no reason to refuse. However...
Souei, was it? I have one condition.
I wish to meet your master, Rimuru Tempest.
Very well. Then we will make preparations and meet you here in seven days. You will have an audience with him then.
Ensure that you do not wage battle before then.
I feel as if I've seen the light of hope. Gather everyone together.
The Orc army has already drawn near to this underground cave. But there is nothing to fear. In seven days, powerful reinforcements will join us.
Until then, we will remain here and conserve our strength for battle. Do not even think of striking first!
Any who die in battle will be eaten by the enemy and become their strength! That is what it means to fight the Orc Lord.
Once our reinforcements join us, we will launch a counterattack. Resist fighting until then! I will not tolerate a single death among my men!
@exp SoeiDefault.Normal.Exclusive_1:I'm not sure this really qualifies as a scout, but it must be dealt with.
@exp Benimaru.Puzzle.Exclusive_1: I haven't been getting much exercise lately. Hopefully a magical beast will attack, or something.
It's good to know you're on the job, but if I leave that to you, the forest will take too much damage...
@exp Benimaru.Smile.Exclusive_1: Great Rimuru, I've found something handy. I think you'd find it more useful than I would, so please, take it.
Yeah? You sure? You're a good man, Benimaru.
@exp Kurobei.Sad.Idle:Man, I'd sure like to drink a nice tall glass of something tasty...
I can relate... I can relate, Kurobe! Guys need to take a load off from time to time!
@exp Treyni.Normal.Exclusive_1: Heh, it was a close call, but I was still able to fulfil my role as caretaker of the forest.
@exp Treyni.Normal.Exclusive_1: It's not the first time I've ever seen a town grow, but it is the first time I've ever seen a town grow this fast.
I've got those materials you needed. Will this work?
@exp Kurobei.Smile.Idle:Hmm... Yes, that's all of it! Thank you, your help has been invaluable from the start!
Then I look forward to the finished sword. Make something to be proud of.
@exp Kurobei.Smile.Exclusive_1:Of course! You'll be more than satisfied, just wait and see!
That's the spirit! I can't wait to see it!
Wow, you were so flustered, you dropped your sword... That was a total blind spot.
@exp Hakuro.Sad.Idle:You caught me completely off guard. What a blunder...
I'm surprised by your response. Weren't you able to completely erase your presence before?
@exp Hakuro.Sad.Exclusive_1:Yes, everyone in the Ogre village knew and feared this...
Shion's cooking truly is an amazing thing...
Everything's going great! Even without my orders, everyone's doing their job. Makes it easier for me!
Besides, there's something important I need to do.
This Mimic skill works really smoothly. An actual human body... Feels great to have this.
I have a human's field of vision, but in slime form, I could see behind me. Probably thanks to Magic Sense.
Hey, Great Sage, since I ate Ifrit, can I use body doubles now, too?
Answer: All of Ifrit's skills, including Body Double, have been analyzed.
All right, great! I'll try it out right now. Body Double!
Wh-Whoa! I couldn't tell without a mirror, but now I see. I really do look like Shizu.
No trace at all of how I looked when I was alive. What a beautiful...boy? Girl?
Well, I need to know what sex my body is, right? Though I can kind of already tell.
My 'magic wand' didn't make it. I seem rather androgynous. In fact, I have no gender at all! I'm sexless!
Wait... Now that I think about it, when I took human form earlier, I didn't see any of the usual black mist.
Answer: When using Mimic to assume a form larger than one's own, black mist produced by magicule consumption makes up the difference.
Oh. So that means...I could create an adult form, too! All right!
Ooh! Can I make it look masculine?
Hey, he's pretty handsome! Okay, now make it feminine!
I can't do that. Giving myself an adult female form makes me look like Shizu, and that just feels immoral.
But it doesn't feel like a body double since I can modify it at will. Wonder if it's as powerful as me. If so, it would be really handy.
@exp GazelDwargo.Grin.Exclusive_1: Well? How's it suit me?
We defeated the magical beast, and investigated the area... Mission accomplished, Souei!
@exp Soei.Smile.Exclusive_1:Yes, you were a great help. Now I know what areas around the town to focus on.
I'd like to improve our defenses based on this new information. Would that be acceptable, Great Rimuru?
I know that you've been working real hard to make that happen. Of course it's acceptable! Please!
@exp Treyni.Normal.Exclusive_1: It's a lot more like a real town than it was back at the beginning.
@exp Treyni.Normal.Exclusive_1: I guess you just naturally draw people to you, Great Rimuru.
Is there some kind of trick to working at the forge?
@exp Kurobei.Smile.Exclusive_1:Pay attention to the color of the flames!
@exp Geld.Normal.Exclusive_1:I've prepared this in the hope that it will bring you joy, Great Rimuru.
@exp Benimaru.Normal.Exclusive_1: Have you seen Gobta around? I was teaching him and Hakurou a lesson, and he suddenly disappeared.
Um, yes. Well, maybe it's a good time to call it quits for the day. I have to admit, I feel a little sorry for the guy being paired up with Hakurou like that.
@exp Benimaru.Smile.Exclusive_1: Great Rimuru, I've found something handy. I think you'd find it more useful than I would, so please, take it.
Yeah? You sure? You're a good man, Benimaru.
Ah, you've returned. Did you succeed in recruiting the Goblins to assist us?
Yes, sir! They number 7,000 in total. They are standing by.
Why must we remain here in the face of an Orc attack? This is not how the proud Lizardman race fights.
While you were away, we were approached with an offer of alliance. Until they join us, our best option is to focus on defense.
Using the natural labyrinths may be a fine tactic against a large army, but it divides our forces into too many corridors, keeping us from meeting the enemy at full strength!
G-Gabiru, what is the meaning of this?
Be calm, captain of the guard. I have no intention of harming you.
I will apologize later for resorting to violence. You may feel uncomfortable while restrained, but bear with it until I defeat the Orc Lord.
Son! I will not allow you to do this! Unhand me at once!
Gabiru... no, Brother! Please, come to your senses!
Th-This power... Vortex Spear, you acknowledge me as your master now?
We've seized the leaders of each clan. There were a lot of young ones who didn't agree with this defensive battle.
We're all behind you. We're counting on you, Sir Gabiru.
Of course. I will show you how a true Lizardman fights! The time has come!
There is no need to fear these pigs! These marshlands are our domain! We will throw them into confusion! We will not lose to these dimwits whose feet are held by the mud!
Our attack is making a dent!
What's happening? The Orcs...are eating other Orcs?
Trample all! Trample all! Trample all! The strength of this comrade we eat is now ours! The strength of this prey we eat is now ours!
Trya, I was able to gather some really fine materials in that spot you pointed out! Would it be all right if we keep going there?
@exp Trya.Smile.Exclusive_1:Oh, of course. That's why I told you where it is.
Great. Then we'll have to think of ways to utilize it. First, we'll have to do a survey and determine the best way to cut open a path from the town...
@exp Trya.Puzzle.Idle:You're going to cut open a path... through the forest?
@exp Gabiru.Smile.Exclusive_1:I've found something I think will suit you, Great Rimuru! Please, take it!
Oh, you're too kind. Thank you, Gabiru!
@exp Gobta.Smile.Exclusive_1: Nice weather today. Think I'll go fishing...
Ah, Treyni. Good timing. There's a new type of snack. Would you like to try it?
Oh, for sure! Let's go together!
*wheeze wheeze* Even ants pack a punch in large numbers. They almost carried me away to their hole...
Haha... I told Papa, I'm gonna go think up an even more amazing skill, but the joke's on me for having such a tough time against ants like these.
An even more amazing skill... Maybe Mother would know something that could help. I should get going. Hm? The mirror's gone! There are only trees! The forest is in full bloom!
Searching for the nearest mirror... The Kingdom of Ingrassia is nearby.
Did I go that far while I was eating?! I really ate myself into a corner here. Oh well, what can you do? A human kingdom is bound to have lots of mirrors, so that's where I'll go.
Oh, but I bet Mother's going to be mad at me for coming home so late.
Try as I might, it seems I can't escape from this slime's stomach…
What? What are YOU looking at?!
How did—? Why are you here?!
@exp Gobta.Smile.Exclusive_1: Hehe, I've gotten pretty strong too...
Teeheehee, I'm sure I'm no match for you, Great Rimuru!
All right, time for another peaceful day—
It seems strange that there would be so many of them, just by chance...
Oh, and just as I'd hoped you could try on my latest creations...
Not the dress-up routine again... Need to thank those magical beasts.
There's not too many. I'll take care of them and be right back.
Don't worry about it. They don't look too tough.
Great Rimuru, your heart is magnanimous as always! Wait here, and your secretary Shion will go clean up this mess!
Those who bare fangs against our village face the same fate as all those who do wrong to our Master! I'll smite them in an instant.
Shion and Ranga should be enough to beat them without too much trouble...
Bwahaha! Allow me! I won't let anyone mess with my best friend's village!
Things have been too peaceful lately. We've been aching for a good fight. Please, let us go deal with them.
Ah, haha! Everyone's so full of fighting spirit.
Wait, everyone! If I unleash all of you, you'll tear the village apart!
I'd better take care of this myself.
What? Master, you're taking the field yourself?!
I'll always be by your side.
Great Rimuru! Watch what I can do for you!
Hey, hey! Did you all hear what I just said?
No fair! I wanna fight, too! Don't worry, I'll be gentle.
Oh... You are afraid we'll go overboard, and make a mess of the area?
And so you want us to keep the magical beasts away without scolding them too severely.
No one has any intention of staying behind. Well, I certainly don't. So...Great Rimuru, what shall you do?
Huh... I see there's no holding any of you back.
@exp RimuruDefault.Surprise.Think: I see. So you developed another magic circle that can amplify our power even further?
@exp VestaDefault.Smile.Bow: Yes sir, Great Rimuru! This time, I've designed a magic circle to work with the attribute of wind.
@exp VestaDefault.Angry.Exclusive_1: All sorts of different people have joined your cause, Great Rimuru. This should help the ones who use air magic and skills!
@exp RimuruDefault.Smile.Nod: Fantastic, Vesta! Of course you have my permission to set it up. May it help the town.
@exp VestaDefault.Smile.Bow: Leave it to me, Great Rimuru!
@exp RimuruDefault.Surprise.Relax:Whoa... So this is the new central office...
@exp RimuruDefault.Puzzle.Sad:But now that the town is developing so nicely, aren't there a lot of other things we'll need, in addition to the central office building?

@exp RigurdDefault.Cool.Think:That's certainly true. We'll need to secure food and resources, and to maintain and expand the town... As we gain the ability to do more, so too will the need to think of various necessities grow.
@exp RimuruDefault.Smile.Joy:Well said... I'll worry my brains out about it here in this new central office building!
@exp Gabiru.Smile.Idle:Great Rimuru, I found this while working!
Oh-ho, nice. Can I have it?
@exp Hakuro.Bitter.Idle: Gobta sure is an interesting guy. He's got character. Too bad he's not a tad more serious though...
@exp Hakuro.Smile.Exclusive_1: The citizenry is growing. Anyone can enjoy life in this town, regardless of race... It's truly fantastic.
@exp GazelDwargoDefault.Normal.Exclusive_1:Rimuru, now that we have this alliance, I'll be stopping by to check up on you from time to time.
I don't mind that, but what about Dwargon? Don't they need their king to be there full-time?
@exp GazelDwargoDefault.Angry.Idle:Hmph. My kingdom's not so fragile that it can't do without constant supervision.
...Having said that, some busybody might come looking for me, to take me back home.
Doesn't that mean that they actually do need you...? You can do what you want, but don't expect me to hide you, all right?
Bah! You're my junior, not my babysitter...
@exp GazelDwargoDefault.Smile.Exclusive_1:Anyway, I'll be enjoying your new kingdom to the hilt!
@exp GazelDwargo.Smile.Exclusive_1: What a wonderful place to enjoy some rest and relaxation this is! I'll have to sneak away and come back more often...
@exp Kaijin.Smile.Exclusive_1: Isn't it about time you had your weapons repaired in the workshop, Rimuru? Bring them on by sometime.
I can tell I'm in Dwarven country! It looks so much more civilized than the Goblin Village.
This way. Don't get lost, now.
Wow! Such detailed workmanship! What's up with that sword? Is it actually glowing?! Is it magic?
Yeah, that's where we're headed. The guy who made the sword is the blacksmith we're about to meet.
This is the place. I guarantee his skills are top-notch! Hey, Bro, you there?
Hey, Kaido. Give me a sec.
Wow... He definitely seems like the tough-as-nails workman type.
A slime? Friend of yours, boys?
Kaijin, this is the slime we told you about.
The one that saved us when we were hurt yesterday.
Oh, so this is the one! You have my thanks.
Oh, no, really, it was nothing... or maybe it was something? Hahaha!
So, what can I do for you?
Right, about that... Would you be interested in a job back in our village? By our, I mean the Goblin village. Our clothing and homes are pretty shabby.
I see... I'm sorry. I'm pretty backed up at the moment, thanks to the impossible order a certain numskull minister put in.
We might be going to war soon, so he asked for twenty longswords by the end of the week, no less. I'm short on materials, so I've only made one so far.
Couldn't you have refused? I mean, it's impossible without the materials you need.
Don't be stupid! I did tell him that, at first! But then that damned Minister Vesta said...
My, my! The great Kaijin that everyone calls the best blacksmith around can't handle such a simple task?
He had the nerve to say that! Could you have let that slide?! That bastard!
My boss was like that, too. I guess interpersonal relationships are a pain in any world.
Never mind about that. So, you say you're short on materials?
Yeah, I need a special material called magic ore.
We were trying to dig some up yesterday, but that Armorsaurus showed up.
But that mine was pretty well cleared out, anyway. Didn't seem like there was any magic ore left.
And even if I did have the materials, it'll take two weeks to make twenty swords! Yet I have to get them to the king in five days.
They contracted smiths all over the kingdom and allotted the work to all of us. If I can't do it, my certification as a smith could be revoked.
That really sucks. ...Wait. Magic ore? You mean this?
That's magic ore! And it's unbelievably pure! Wait, no! It's already been processed! It's a cluster of magisteel!
I can make even stronger swords with this! This entire cluster is... You're sure I can have this? I'll pay you handsomely, of course!
Well, now... I wonder what I should do...
Rrk... What is it you want? I'll do anything in my power for it!
That's what I wanted to hear.
I'd like you to find some fellow artisans who'll come to my village to teach their crafts.
Our priority right now is the 'shelter and clothing' part of food, shelter, and clothing. I'd also like to get some clothing for future use, as well as weapons and armor.
But even if you start on those swords now...
Well, I'll do what I can. All right, let's get started!
You said you've already made one, right? Can I see it?
It's magnificent. Even an untrained eye like mine can tell you have real skill. The blade looks like it's glowing.
It has a magisteel core. Put simply, it's a sword that matures in the image of its user.
That's incredible! Sure wish you'd come to the village yourself.
Ha ha, if it weren't for current circumstances...
On that note, I'm gonna borrow that sword for a moment.
Huh?! Wh-What do you think you're...?!
Just give me a second. ...Great Sage, analyze it.
Use some magisteel clusters to make some copies.
Twenty longswords completed from magisteel clusters.
I made copies with one of my skills.
By all means, test them out to see whether or not they're perfect copies. All 20 should perform exactly the same.
@exp Kaijin.Normal.Idle:I can tell just by looking at them. Still, I can't risk delivering an inferior product. Care to join me in testing them out?
If that's the proof you need, I'd be happy to help.
@exp Kaijin.Normal.Proposal:Word is magical beasts have recently been sighted in the nearby wasteland. Couldn't think of a better way to test these blades.
@exp Hakuro.Smile.Exclusive_1: The children have been badgering me lately, so I started teaching them how to use a sword. Would you be interested in joining us, Great Rimuru?
Oh, yeah? I'll stop by when I have a moment sometime.
@exp Vesta.Smile.Idle:Thanks to your assistance, all the necessary magicules have been absorbed. Hehehe, time to reveal the masterpiece I have created using the very best spirit engineering!
Spirit engineering... You can't be serious. You mean you made a Magisoldier? One of those things that represented your greatest failure, and which resulted in a horrific tragedy...
@exp Vesta.Angry.Exclusive_1:I...reflected on that failure, and made sure not to make any of the same mistakes! What I've created this time is...Ultraminiature Magisoldier Prototype #1!
Ooh... It's tiny enough to ride on the palm of your hand...
@exp Vesta.Puzzle.Idle:It exploded?! A failure?! Then in that case...I must take this into consideration for my next experiment...

(He worked so hard, only for it to end in failure...and yet he's already prepared to apply what he's learned to his next experiment. Nothing ever gets that man down. What an amazing researcher Vesta is.)
@exp RimuruDefault.None.Think: Vesta, I heard you wanted permission to set up a magic circle. What kind is it?
@exp VestaDefault.Smile.Bow: It's a kind of magic circle that will increase your powers and those of your allies even further!
@exp VestaDefault.Angry.Exclusive_1: I've succeeded in developing a magic circle that can improve the effects of space attribute abilities. Please, let me build it!
@exp RimuruDefault.None.Relax: I see... And with that kind of magic circle, we could raise the level of our fighting capabilities.
@exp RimuruDefault.Smile.Angry: All right, no time like the present! Make it right away, Vesta!
To think that just naming you would change you so much! I hardly recognize you anymore!
Now I think we can work on the village while fighting off external threats...or can we?
Ah ha! So you noticed, eh, Ifrit?
Honestly, the way you've been acting, it's hard not to notice.
But who can blame me? After all these years, I'm going to be released from Unlimited Imprisonment.
What I should do once I'm out?
Rimuru's been wanting to defeat the Demon Lord Clayman... Perhaps I'll go and show him what for.
Lord Veldora, allow me to give you some advice.
Once you're free, you should probably avoid doing anything too...impulsive.
Fine, let me spell it out for you. If you keep acting without thinking, you're only going to cause more trouble!
(It's not like Ifrit to be so forward...)
More trouble? Ifrit, when have I ever done anything to cause you trouble?
...Pardon me. I was just a little surprised.
Yes, really. Don't look at me like that.
Anyway, that's not important. Let me get back to the point...
Think about everything Great Rimuru has done up until now. He always consults his allies before making a move, yes?
True. He's very considerate of others—
There! That's exactly what I'm talking about!
You've seen through to the very heart of the matter!
(I have? ...Of course I have. Such a matter is child's play for a monster as perceptive as me.)
Then let me put it this way. Consideration for others is the key to everything!
Ah, I see. It really is just as I said before.
I-I suppose... But I have more to say on the matter.
You are powerful, Lord Veldora. No one can deny that.
But that power sets you apart from others.
That wasn't a compliment. You should reel it in a little!
You've been thinking about going to defeat the Demon Lord Clayman on your own, haven't you?
(How did he know that?! And...is he saying I shouldn't?)
I-I have no idea what you're talking about...
Of course! Would I lie to you?
(I feel like it would be admitting defeat to own up to it now...)
All right. But if you want to stand by Great Rimuru as a friend, there's one thing you should bear in mind.
As the one who set you free, he'll be seen as responsible for anything you do from here on.
That makes you something of a mixed blessing.
Even with the best of intentions, you could end up making a bad situation worse.
As one of the strongest monsters around, you have a duty to consult with others before acting.
You wouldn't want Great Rimuru to start hating you, would you?
In that case, try to be mindful of the consequences of your actions.
And promise me you'll practice a little more patience and restraint from now on!
Okay, I'm gonna let you out now, Veldora.
Oooh! I feel something inside me changing, evolving! My Unique skill Inquirer has become Faust!
My tireless search for truth in all things has manifested itself as this unparalleled new power!
Hey, that's great. I'm happy for you.
No reply? Isn't this usually where—
The big day is finally here.
Rimuru is going to set me free. And he's heading back to where this all began to do it. How appropriate.
Gabiru looked thrilled to be left in charge of the place in the meantime. That's nothing compared to the joy I'm feeling, though.
Ifrit's words had put me in a good mood. I was curious to hear what he'd come out with next.
Consideration? Ha! Ifrit worries too much. None of Rimuru's underlings are half so considerate as me.
Take Shion. Even death didn't teach her any restraint. Not so long ago she tore Gobta apart with a few careless words.
Such a blunder would be out of the question for me.
Geld has potential, I'll give him that, but he's far too reserved. He could stand to be a little more assertive.
As for Shuna, her heart is in the right place, but she lacks the strength to back it up. And Benimaru is too reliant on Rimuru.
Rimuru has plenty of subordinates, but I'm really the only one worthy of standing as his equal.
I nodded agreement and promised Ifrit I'd do as he suggested.
I heard Rimuru calling for me, and my heart took flight.
Freedom, at last... I thought I'd have to wait at least another century. It seems so sudden. Everything is going to change.
From this day on, I'll be by Rimuru's side, assisting him in all matters...
...Or at least, that's what I thought.
Where was the excitement? The praise and adulation for my triumphant revival?
Rimuru was just as calm and composed as always. Did I do something wrong?
Could he have found out about me spying on him and the things he's been doing?
I thought I'd covered my tracks, but perhaps not... It would explain why things felt so awkward between us.
I still have one more trick up my sleeve, though. This will surely make Rimuru see me in a different light!
I'd practiced that line over and over again just for an occasion like this, and I pulled it off perfectly.
Rimuru just brushed the whole thing off! How can this be?
I don't think anyone would blame me for feeling perplexed.
But this is no time to mope. I ought to be celebrating my newfound freedom.
Rimuru even used Enhanced Body Double to give me a whole new body. And it is glorious!
It fits me like a glove, right down to the last magicule.
Maybe this is because of me being inside Rimuru for so long.
The intermingling of our magicules has made us so alike, this body is a perfect match for me.
What a stroke of luck... Or did he plan for it to happen this way?
Affirmative. A body strong enough to support a True Dragon's spirit was stipulated in advance.
Ah, there it is. I suppose I'm no longer directly linked to Raphael now I'm my own entity again.
No Ifrit either, naturally. It feels a little strange to be out on my own.
Ifrit... I promised you I'd try to be more patient and restrained. Now seems like a good time to put that into practice.
As eager as I am to start assisting Rimuru, for now, I'll ease into things and just talk to him.
Rimuru asked me to learn to suppress my aura, so I began training at once.
@exp Rigurd.Grin.Exclusive_1: Such a fantastic outfit! I'm not worthy of this honor!
@exp Hakuro.Cool.Exclusive_1: Oh, hullo there Great Rimuru! I haven't seen you for training lately, have I?
Rrgh! Oh, sorry, I've had lots of other tasks to take care of lately!
@exp GabiruAnother.Puzzle.None:Urgh... Ohh... Rrk... I'm not done yet!
@exp GabiruAnother.Angry.None:I can't betray them again... Their expectations! The dignity of my people!
@exp Rimuru.None.Sigh:And that's why you're fragile. I mean, you could fall down at any moment...
What the hell are you— Guwaaarrr!!!
Uwaaah! Daddy, my daddy, my daddy!
What?! It smashed his way out of the mirror by itself?! Is that slime... more powerful than me?!
By the way, Rigur, who gave your brother his name?
Sir! I'm told he received his name from a passing Demon called Lord Gelmud. He saw promise in him.
Gelmud. He's an officer in the Demon Lord's army. But my brother didn't change as much as we have.
Demon Lord's army?! There's a Demon Lord, too?! Come to think of it, Veldora said there was a hero, too.
I hope I never end up meeting them. Sounds like nothing but trouble. In fact, the level of evolution seems to differ depending on the namer.
The one who gave a name... Like a parent? Hey, Ranga. I killed your father, right?
You don't hold a grudge against me?

I have only gratitude toward you, and no resentment at all. Our loyalty belongs to you and you alone, Master!
With the help of Ranga and his pack mates, we'll be nearing Dwargon soon. It would've taken us two months on foot.
Is it okay for monsters like me to enter Dwargon?
No need to worry. Dwargon is a neutral free-trade city. The Hero King Gazel Dwargo forbids all fighting within his realm.
They took a massive natural cavern and transformed it into a city teaming with Dwarves, Elves, and Humans.
Their immense military might has made free trade possible, and it's said the Dwarven army has been undefeated for a thousand years.
A thousand years? That is impressive! No one would be dumb enough to get on the king's bad side.
Well, last time I went there, they picked a fight with me outside the gate—
So you say there are Elves there?! We definitely have to meet them! Hm? I'm pretty sure that huge flag just went up, or was it just me?
So that's where the Elves... I mean, the Dwarves are, huh?
I hope some beautiful Elves... I mean, some skilled Dwarves are waiting there for us.
Are you sure you want to go in with just Gobta, Great Rimuru?
Yeah. We don't want to draw too much attention with a big group. I just need Gobta to show me the way.
This is quite a line. They must be strict about checking everyone.
Once we're inside, we can move around as we please, though.
Hey! Hey, hey, hey! What's a couple of monsters doing here?!
We're not inside yet, so we can still kill them, right?
I was beat up here last time I tried to get in, too. It's the fate of us weak monsters.
Hey, we're talking to you! Give us everything you got, and we'll cut you some slack.
Wait, isn't a talking slime pretty rare? I bet we could make a fortune off of it!
Gobta. Do you remember our first rule?
Of course, sir! Rule one: no attacking humans!
All right, now, close your eyes and cover your ears. Don't look this way, whatever you do.
Now, then... I'm the generous sort, so I'll spare you if you leave immediately. Scram!
What did you just say?! You're just a puny little weakling monster! Guess we really do gotta kill ya!
@exp GazelDwargo.Grin.Exclusive_1: Hehehe, this place finally looks like a real town!
(I can get out of that little trick easily with my extra skill Molecular Manipulation.)
You use this magic well. Make sure you keep studying it!
(Ack, she's crying... You'll have to forgive me. I needed to show you the overwhelming difference in skill between us so that you'll start listening to me!)
@exp GazelDwargo.Smile.Exclusive_1: Many of those in this land with confidence in their abilities are apprentices of the Savant. I think I'll do my part as a senior too, from time to time.
@exp Ranga.Sad.Exclusive_1: If we hadn't met my master back then, what would have become of us?
@exp Hakuro.Smile.Idle: Kurobe and Kaijin have hit it off together really well. I'm glad Kurobe found someone to work on his forging techniques with.
@exp Hakuro.Smile.Exclusive_1: I'll gladly break my old bones working for the good of this town.
@exp Kaijin.Smile.Exclusive_1: Rimuru... Would it be all right if we snuck off and paid the Elf girl's shop another visit sometime?

@exp RimuruDefault.Puzzle.Think:I appreciate all the hard work you've put into rebuilding the central office, but hasn't that put an undue strain on all your people?

@exp RimuruDefault.Smile.Exclusive_1:Oh... Thank you for all that you do.
@exp Gobta.Puzzle.Idle:Great Rimuru, you saved me! I never expected monsters to attack ME from behind...

I'm so ashamed... I'll never do that again...
Good. As long as you've learned your lesson!
@exp Gobta.Grin.Idle: As a Goblin, I have to say this is an impressive town!
Um, Rigurd? Is this enough for you?
@exp Rigurd.Smile.Exclusive_1:Yes, now we're ready do make it all! Next, I'll be delegating all the production and construction work!

@exp Treyni.Surprise.Exclusive_1:How do you get so much done all the time, Great Rimuru?
It's because of all the excellent people I have working for me! I don't have to work all that much, actually.

That's quite a selfish request from someone who just appeared out of nowhere, Treyni the Dryad.
Why have you come here? There are races far stronger than Goblins.

Were our settlement to be attacked by the Orc Lord, the Dryads could not hope to fight them alone.
This is why I have come to request assistance from someone strong.
The idea that the Orc Lord even existed was still just a theory to us.
The Dryads have knowledge of essentially everything that happens in this forest.

Let's continue the conference. Anyone have any ideas what the Orcs might be after?
One thing does come to mind.
Souei, did you investigate our village?
Judging by your reaction, I assume...
Correct. Not a single one belonging to either our brethren or the Orcs.
We didn't understand how they were getting the supplies to keep an army of 200,000 fed.
It's a skill that the Orc Lord, a calamity that brings chaos to the world, is born with.
Its influence reaches all those who serve under him, making them devour everything in sight, like locusts.
At the same time, they consume the victim's strength and abilities, making them their own sustenance.
It's quite similar to your Predator skill.
The price for obtaining Starved is constant, insatiable hunger. The Orcs move forward for no other purpose than to sate their endless hunger and gain more power.
That is their king's only wish.
So the Orcs' goal isn't to wipe out the superior forest races, the Ogres and Lizardmen, but to steal their powers?
Well, if that's the case, I can't say we're in the clear. We have Tempest Wolves, Kijin, and Hobgoblins.
Flavors aside, they're all meals with powers that the Orcs would kill for.
Aren't you forgetting the one meal that would attract them the most?
In addition, we have confirmed that a certain majin is behind the Orc Lord's appearance. I believe it is someone you won't want to overlook.
It is a subordinate of a Demon Lord, after all.
(They have knowledge of everything that happens in the forest, huh? This lady's shrewd.)

As the one who subjugated the Direwolves and became the patron of the Kijin, you are surely more than a match for the Orc Lord.

That Orc Lord is no match for Great Rimuru!
Oh, you agree with me, then?

Would you mind gathering the materials I need to temper blades?

This is the Jura Tempest Federation.
All sorts of different monsters live together here in peace. It's a unique country, unlike the rest of the world.
It may seem strange to see a slime living in a place like this, but I'm actually the leader of the Federation. Don't judge a book by its cover.
Believe it or not, I actually used to be human before I got reincarnated as a slime!
I died while defending a younger coworker from a random attacker... but was reincarnated here in this other world.
Somehow, the things I wished for during my dying moments were granted...and now here I am reborn in this wonderful slime body!
I've been through a lot. In fact, I'm still getting caught up in all sorts of messes. All things considered though, life is pretty good.
This place is really looking up these days.

I must know...how it is made.

Well, time to head on back! ...But I can't shake the feeling that I'm forgetting something. Probably just my imagination.
Not good. Even if we win, we'll barely squeak by. It's an even match!
