@exp RimuruDefault.Grin.Joy:You've done a fantastic job! Both the construction and the decorations are top-notch! @exp RimuruDefault.Normal.Think: Was it a lot of work to rebuild it like this?
@exp RigurdDefault.Smile.Proposal:We worked as hard as you might expect, but since this is the administrative hub of the nation, everyone really wanted to give it their all.
@exp RimuruDefault.Smile.Relax:I really appreciate it all of your efforts... This will definitely be a new symbol for the town!
@exp Ranga.Angry.Exclusive_1:*sniff sniff* It's faint, but I can still smell it. If we go now, we might be able to catch it!
But...it would be a bad idea to chase it too far at this point. You're pretty much spent after this last battle, right?
I know it's frustrating, but let's wait for another opportunity.
(The two of us aren't enough to catch it... This monster Ranga's been chasing after really is one seriously tough customer....)
So, why did you come here?
Hmph. You expect me to answer a lowly slime?
You may call me lowly, but I'm stronger than you.
I don't know this Demon Lord Carrion. Depending on how you behave, my people could become Carrion's enemies.
Or do you want to be responsible for antagonizing the entire Great Forest of Jura?
Hah! That's big talk. This whole town is loyal to a lowly monster like you? Must be rough having nothing but weaklings around. Don't get a big head just because Lady Milim took a liking to you.
Hey! Are you talking trash about my friend?
Milim, stop. If you do anything else, you can kiss dinner goodbye.
Now, it's true that I'm a slime. But it's also a fact that I rule 31% of this forest, and if you're really serious, we may have no choice but to declare war.
So think carefully before you answer me.
Lord Carrion ordered me to come here and scout some mysterious majin who defeated the Orc Disaster.
(Looks like Milim wasn't the only Demon Lord who had an eye on that battle.)
Damn that Carrion! He broke his promise!
Well, I get the picture. You can leave now.
Well, I can't kill him, can I? Tell the Demon Lord Carrion:
If he wants to talk, he can choose a date and contact us again.
Doesn't look like he'll relay any message for us... Okay, I want to know all about this Demon Lord Carrion.
I can't tell you that. We've sworn not to interfere with each other.
(And there it is! She just confessed that there's some secret!)
Huh. So did you all promise to keep each other's secrets?
Uh, um, not exactly, but interference is—
Hey, it's okay! Carrion used his underling to interfere with you, didn't he?
And we're besties, so we help each other out, right?
If I don't know what kind of promise you made, I might end up interfering without realizing it...
I know! I'll make a weapon for you! I'm concerned for you as your bestie, after all!
A new weapon?! Yeah, that's right! Nothing's more important than your bestie!
(As long as we're on the same page...)
Demon Lords Clayman, Carrion, Frey, and you, Milim, used Gelmud in a scheme to create a puppet Demon Lord.
It was just a way to kill time!
Maybe that's all it was to you, but since we butted in, I guess it's inevitable that they'd target us...
It seems likely that other Demon Lords will become involved, as well.
What a predicament... We must consult with Lady Treyni.
It'll be fine! Great Rimuru has nothing to fear from any of those Demon Lords!
Well, I've told you the secret. Now give me my new weapon like you promised, bestie!
Whoa, this is bad! Don't go over there, that's what it wants you to do!
But, but, if we keep fighting here, there's no way we'll beat it!
Hey! Guys! I can't hold out much— Argh! Watch it!
How have you morons stayed alive so long by being this careless?! Have I been covering for you too much?!
Sounds like some people have encountered a monster.
A Knight Spider?! Bah! Rommel, use a strengthening spell on me! Kajir, take command! Assume a circle formation! Remove and heal anyone who gets hurt.
This is an order! Everyone stay alive!
And you guys... I'll make you pay for getting us involved in this later.
Good to see you again! You're fighting monsters every time I see you. Do you enjoy fighting that much?
@exp Gabiru.Puzzle.Idle:*pant, pant* I've taken on so many magical beasts, and yet still, my spear does not respond...

@exp Gabiru.Angry.Exclusive_1:Of course not! I'll draw forth this spear's power once again, you'll see!
@exp Gabiru.Smile.Idle:Today is a day of celebration for you, Great Rimuru! So it goes without saying that I must give you a present to commemorate this joyous occasion!

Ooh, thank you. You never stop working, do you?
@exp Kurobei.Smile.Exclusive_1: Great Rimuru, I think we're almost ready to make something even more amazing than before!
Ooh, let me know when that happens. I'll come have a look right away.
@exp Treyni.Smile.Exclusive_1: There's always something happening around you, Great Rimuru. Never a dull moment.
Answer: Event exists that will end today.
@exp RimuruDefault.None.Think: Hey Rigurd, how are our seafood supplies holding up? Wanna make sure they're secure?
@exp RigurdDefault.Grin.Exclusive_1: Yes, of course I'd like to do that! Seafood has its own unique flavor, different from the bounty of the forest!
@exp RimuruDefault.Notice.Nod: I know, right? So how about a shack for the guys surveying the waterfront? They could use it as a base for fishing, right?
@exp RigurdDefault.Smile.Exclusive_2: Ah, excellent idea Great Rimuru! I'll get right on it!
The forest has been boisterous lately, but I won't let anyone get away with any nasty tricks.
@exp GazelDwargo.Smile.Idle:Oh-ho, you've really outdone yourself with all these ingredients.
It's all for your royal plate, Your Majesty. It took a while to round up, but only the best will do.
Our fantastic chef will take these items and turn them into amazing dishes. Of course, everything will be perfectly suited for a meal with sake, just as you requested.
@exp GazelDwargo.Grin.Exclusive_1:Ah, hahaha, I look forward to it. I'll have to be careful not to drink too much, though.
Why do you ask for special weapons just for one particular person sometimes?
@exp Gabiru.Smile.Exclusive_1:This symbolizes the fealty we, the Lizardmen, have sworn to you, Great Rimuru! Here, here! Please accept it!
All right already, you don't have to shove it in my face... Of course I'll take it, if it represents how all of you feel.
What is a man of your standing doing here?
It's good to see you again, Fuze. What Great Rimuru says is true. King Gazel and Rimuru have signed a treaty.
W-Well... If that is the case, we aren't opposed to cooperating with you.
But I'll need to see undeniable proof that you are, in fact, an ally of Humans. I assume that's all right?
Oh, sure. That's to be expected. I'm just fine with that. I'll permit you to stay here. I want you to understand that we aren't a threat.
By the way, Fuze, has the news that the Orc Lord was defeated already gotten around?
Huh? No, only our king and a select handful of people know that.
Youm, want to make a contract with me?
Huh? What are you even talki—
You said the Kingdom of Falmuth hired you with money, right? So you'd just be switching employers.
To put it in simple terms... I want you guys to be the champions who defeated the Orc Lord.
I mean even now, after the threat of the Orc Lord has been eliminated, I still make you guys nervous because I'm a slime monster. Right?
Just say that we simply helped you out, and start a rumor that you were the one who defeated the Orc Lord.
I figure, that way, I can be known as the trustworthy monster who assisted the champion.
Let's establish that as my position.
I think it'll be easier to befriend people that way than if they think I'm some mysterious, threatening monster. What do you say?
This town is really something. After seeing everyone here, I know you're not some evil being.
We are people of guilty conscience. We always longed to be free men.
We accepted the mission to come here because we planned to make everyone think we'd died on the way and then head for some safe nation. And yet...
I've decided. I'll follow you! That sounds more fun, anyway.
Allow me to call you Master Rimuru from now on. I am at your command.
Sure. I'll be counting on you.
Welcome back. That didn't take long. You weren't noticed, were you, Tear the Crying Harlequin?
I'm part of the Moderate Harlequin Alliance, too, you know! Have a little faith in me!
Hahaha, I have faith in you! I'm just concerned you might go overboard.
Jeez! Stop treating me like a child already!
Very well. I received word from our scout, Myulan. It seems Milim has taken quite a liking to that majin.
This is turning out to be more interesting than I expected. How truly delightful.
Well, that's great, but what's really going on? Is the majin really so amazing that the Demon Lord Milim would take interest?
Only to the point that we mustn't simply ignore him, to be honest. He was no match for me in terms of strength, after all. But then again, Laplace...
Shall we call it...an eeriness? He says he felt something of that nature.
Oh? If a cunning guy like Laplace said so, maybe there really is something!
At the very least, I think we should find out why the Demon Lord Milim's taken such an interest.
Yes. We certainly will need to gather more information from a variety of different angles, and then give it some thought.
Yeah, we should! So, as for the results of my investigation…
Well, Frey apparently has no interest in getting involved with the Forest of Jura. She seemed wary of something. It was almost as if she was preparing for battle!
And did you find out the reason for that?
Hehe, I did! You won't believe this! She was freaking out, saying Charybdis was going to be revived!
I see, I see. Now, Tear, I have another task I'd like you to handle. Got room in your schedule?
Hehe! I thought you would! I've already called Footman, so a little fighting is no problem!
Heh, that's wonderful, Tear. But I would like you to avoid violence as much as possible. First, seek out the location of the seal and find out whether or not we can tame Charybdis.
Leave it to me, Clayman! Okay, I'm going now!
Charybdis, eh? Makes sense. With power said to rival that of the Demon Lords... I truly look forward to seeing what it is like. Heh heh heh heh heh...
Thus, Youm and his companions began training under Hakurou to look like champions.
So began their life here, in this land.
Geld, you look tired. Are you taking enough breaks?
@exp Geld.Puzzle.Idle:Thank you for your concern. It's just that we've been so busy lately...
I'm actually about to go help with the mining, since we're behind schedule due to that monster the other day.
Gotcha, gotcha. I'll get you that ore. You take a break. That's an order, all right?
@exp Geld.Puzzle.Exclusive_1:...Understood. Thank you for your kindness. I'll take a little break.
Thanks for coming to our town, Kaijin. With you and your Dwarves helping out, we'll be able to expand even further.
@exp Kaijin.Smile.Exclusive_1: Hehehe, to hear you say that fills my artisan's heart with pride!
@exp Rigurd.Smile.Exclusive_1:Thank you so much, Great Rimuru! Once we have these materials, construction of the Great Rimuru statue can start!
@exp Rigurd.None.Idle:Yes! We want to show the world how wonderful you are, Great Rimuru! The plan is to make some kind of symbol for this town!
I asked everyone what they thought would be a good symbol, and it was unanimous. @exp Rigurd.Grin.Exclusive_1:Everyone said that they wanted to honor you with a statue, Great Rimuru! So it's decided!
Wait, it's decided already?! I don't need you to put up a statue, it'd be way too embarrassing!
Hey Kaijin, can you make um, something like a giant robot?

@exp Kaijin.Surprise.Idle:Giant robot? You mean like a huge Magisoldier? So you want me to take a difficult piece of technology, make it gigantic? You never cease to amaze me! That's just like you, sir!
@exp RimuruDefault.None.Proposal:We really have become one big happy family here. Are the new people getting used to the town, do you think?

@exp RimuruDefault.Bitter.Think:Hmm, yes. That's to be expected.
@exp RimuruDefault.Smile.Relax:I see. Guess I'll have to rethink how I run this town. Tell them to come ask at the central office if there are any issues.
Since you stopped it, I had a much easier time taking it down!
Thank you for the assistance, Gabiru.
I'd like to face off against Ranga sometime.
@exp Ranga.Cool.Exclusive_1: We must continue to protect this precious place...
@exp Ranga.Cool.Exclusive_1: I would never even consider leaving Great Rimuru's side.
@exp Kaijin.Normal.Idle: Things are really looking like an actual town around here these days. But you want to expand even further, right?
@exp Milim.Shy.Idle:Yeah! That was a little bit fun! Wahahahaa!
Great. I'll do my best to keep you from getting bored, but please, just don't go crazy in town, all right?
@exp Milim.Sad.Exclusive_1:You worry too much, Rimuru. I'm always careful, you know?
You're too powerful even when you're careful, Milim... You almost changed the terrain last time, remember?
That was one pretty girl. You're turning red.
Oh, you're curious about this girl you're destined to be with, huh?
Should you really be wasting time in a place like this, Kaijin?
Is this a good time to be playing around? I believe the deadline for those longswords is...
If you don't get them finished in time... What? You sent them in?!
Ahem... Is that so? Well, finishing your work in the time allotted is to be expected, I dare say.
You shouldn't bring such a lowly monster into a highbrow establishment like this. It's making me feel ill.
Hey! Do you allow monsters to be brought in here?
It may be a monster, but it seems like a harmless slime.
What? It is a monster, am I wrong? Are you trying to say slimes aren't monsters?
No, not in the least. Come, now, Minister. How about a drink? Please, help yourself.
Hmph. This is what should be done to monsters.
Eek! Are you all right, Mr. Slime?
Don't worry. I'm okay. Did your dress get wet?
(I can't let my short temper screw things up for Kaijin and this bar. Plus, the guy's a minister.)
Vesta! I hope you're prepared to pay for treating my guest like that.
You... How dare you speak to me like that?!
Hey, Kaijin? Was that a good idea? Isn't he a minister?
Yeah, this might spell trouble for me. Hey, Rimuru... You were looking for skilled artisans, right?
What?! You mean it? I'd be thrilled to have your help!
Yeah? That's a relief. Now I've got somewhere to go.
Don't hold this against me. It's just the law. I'll have to place you all under arrest until your trial.
C'mon, Bro, what were you thinking? The guy's a minister, remember?
Hmph! That moron there was rude to my savior. I just gave him a little scolding!
I ended up back here again?
You've been asleep all this time?! Since I left?! The whole time?!
I'm sorry. If only I hadn't lost my temper. I dragged you all into this.
Nothing you need to worry about!
Say something! ...Are we going to be put on trial?
Yeah, I guess so. We won't be executed or anything, though. We'll probably just have to pay a fine.
I hope so... But that minister really seemed to have it in for you.
I used to serve this nation's king, Gazel Dwargo. I was captain of one of the seven orders of royal knights.
At the time, he was my adjutant. He came from the marquis's family, and I was from a family of peasants. Taking orders from me must have infuriated him.
Even back then, we clashed all the time.
One of the projects he'd been under pressure to complete, the Magisoldier Project, went up in smoke.
Vesta foisted all the responsibility for his failure onto me. He got our forces on his side and even came up with false testimony.
So I assumed responsibility and quit the force. But he still holds a grudge against me and makes unreasonable demands at every opportunity.
This longsword incident is just one of many.
You got that right. But it's not as if he's a bad guy, really. He and I weren't a good match, but he was always a hard worker, and passionate about his research.
The pressure he felt to complete that project came from his need to please the king. If I leave the kingdom with you, it might make him a better man.
About that... We're gonna follow Kaijin, too.
Yeah. We'll go anywhere if it means we can work with Kaijin.
You guys...! Rimuru, would you mind if a few more artisans tagged along?
I'll be glad to take all of you in! But be ready. I'm gonna work you to the bone!
As we have seen, when Minister Vesta was enjoying a drink in said establishment, Kaijin and his gang stormed the place and assaulted him.
Such behavior must not be tolerated.
What are you talking about?! You're supposed to be defending us.
Upon my word, I would never lie. Plus, even the defendants' lawyer admits they assaulted me.
My bodily injuries are an unadulterated fact! Please pass strict judgment upon these people!
Silence. The next time you speak without the king's consent, it will earn you an immediate guilty verdict.
Analyzing the subject Gazel Dwargo's battle prowess... Commencing simulation...
Destined, huh? If she's also Japanese, I guess I'd like to meet her.
Truth be told, I'm more scared of him than a guilty verdict.
He's definitely formidable. What are we gonna do?! If it comes to a fight...
@exp Kaijin.Smile.Idle: Myrd is an expert in architecture and the arts. He'll contribute mightily to the development of this town!
@exp Gobta.Smile.Idle: Good to see you, Great Rimuru! Are you going somewhere to take a break?

Great Sage, how can I strengthen my troops?
Answer: Current troops comprised of superior individuals.
@exp Shion.Shy.Exclusive_1: Feels pretty good to wear, doesn't it?
@exp Kurobei.Puzzle.Idle:Oh my, what shall I do now...?

But if you're stuck...why not try using totally different materials  this time? I'll get them for you.
@exp Kurobei.Smile.Exclusive_1:Great Rimuru... Since you're so kind as to offer, I'll take you up on it! Please, and thank you in advance!

Footman, huh? We'll have to remember that name.

I don't know anything about them! In fact, if fun people like that are really out there, I wanna meet them!
It may be that it wasn't Gelmud, but Clayman who's plotting something in secret.
He's one of the Demon Lords. He loves coming up with schemes like that.
Regardless of whose scheme I was roped into, what happened was my own responsibility. It has nothing to do with Demon Lord Carrion.
So please, take my life and leave him out of this!
Next time, be more on your toes so you won't be fooled again.
You can move now, right? So you can go.
I don't even want your life. Right, Milim?

I've matured so much, after all. I'm not mad at all, so I forgive you!
There you go. So don't worry about it.
That's right! That's okay with you, right, Carrion?
So you figured it out, Milim?

Yo. Thanks for sparing this guy's life.
You're the masked majin who defeated Gelmud, are you not?
Yeah, that's right. Are you here to avenge him?
It seems my underling here was out of control. That means I was negligent in his oversight. I hope you'll forgive him.
I owe you one after all this. If anything comes up, you can always count on me.
In that case, I'd appreciate it if you'd enter a non-aggression pact with our nation.
That's all you want? Very well. The Demon Lord... No.
The Beastmaster of the Animal Kingdom of Eurazania, Carrion, swears on his name to never raise a blade against your nation.
All right, come on, we're out of here.
Now, then... I guess that's over. Let's head home.

Well, I'd like to reward everyone for their efforts, but I haven't been able to find the time to prepare what I need...
Ah, haha, yeah, that's important. You wanna remember to do that, as a boss. I'd like to help you out in that area, too.
I'm back, Trya. That secret place you told me about is amazing. Not only are there lots of different materials you can harvest, the scenery is beautiful, too.

We won't be attacked out of nowhere, right?
I wanted to try talking to them, but since they would just see a slime, I was afraid they might suddenly attack me...
Their ability to turn invisible is amazing! Just imagine using that to spy on people... So many possibilities! I'll have to make friends with them somehow.

Strong one, having seen your power, we wish to ask a favor.

Thanks to three random adventurers who came by, I was able to get outside.

You idiot! Lord Carrion wouldn't have humiliated himself like this! I just wasn't good enough.

Come to think of it, those guys built a town all on their own.
I saw them as no more than lowly monsters, but they have skills and techniques that even we lack.

Yeah. Even if the Demon Lord Milim hadn't been involved, I couldn't have gained their trust by just taking over without giving them a say.
But it's too late now. My wounds may heal, but this humiliation at the hands of Demon Lord Milim will never fade.
I want to take revenge somehow so I won't cause trouble for Lord Carrion.
That's easy to say, but revenge isn't realistic.

I know it's not logical!
But some things just can't be solved with logic!
Oh how well I understand that vexation you must be feeling!
Greetings, fine people! My name is Footman.
I am a member of the Moderate Harlequin Alliance, the one they call Footman the Angry Pierrot! Pleasure to make your acquaintance!
Now please don't be so guarded. I'm Tear!
I sensed some choice waves of anger, you see. They're from you, are they not?
Please tell me what has angered you so. I'm certain I can be of some help to you.
Sir Phobio, there is no need to listen to these people. May I remove them from your presence?
We are Demon Lord Carrion's Animal King's Brigade. Do you honestly think you wandering majin are any match for us?
You desire power, do you not? We have it... power akin to none you've ever seen.
Naturally, however, it comes with great risk. But should you triumph over that risk, the power you stand to gain is immense.
You want to defeat the Demon Lord Milim, right? Then you just need to become a Demon Lord yourself!
Yeah, if you had the evil power of that gigantic beast-fish, you'd be a Demon Lord's equal... But if you don't want it, we'll just go find someone who does!
Sir Phobio, you mustn't listen to them!
I haven't liked any of this from the start. Why was a useless Orc Lord chosen to be a Demon Lord? That's bull!
If they need a new Demon Lord, I'll... I'll get stronger! Then even Lord Carrion will forgive me with a smile!
Ah! I knew the great Sir Phobio would understand! Yes, of course! There is none more suited than you to be a Demon Lord!
It's just wrong for anyone who isn't strong to be a Demon Lord, right?! That's how I feel, too! And as far as that goes, you're perfect for the job!

We just want you to give us special treatment once you become a Demon Lord! We'd like you to do a few favors for us, too!
Hohoho. We cannot subdue Charybdis on our own, after all.

And we just happened to find you at the perfect time!
I see. But there's no telling whether I can subdue Charybdis or not.
Ho-hoho! If anyone can do it, it's you, Great Sir Phobio!
So when I become a Demon Lord, they want to be the ones credited for helping me the most?

I can't cause trouble for Lord Carrion. Tell him I'm resigning my position in the Beastketeers and leaving the service.

I will become carnage itself and force the Demon Lord Milim to acknowledge my power.

Yeah! I'll be cheering you on!
I can stay underwater longer than you two! What do you think of that?! I won!
